questions.question_text: Which NHRP features active and standby virtual gateways?

discussion.content:
Correct answer: A
GLBP operates virtual gateway redundancy in the same way as HSRP. One gateway is elected as the active virtual gateway (AVG), another gateway is elected as the standby virtual gateway, and the remaining gateways are placed in a listen state. If an AVG fails, the standby virtual gateway will assume responsibility for the virtual IP address. A new standby virtual gateway is then elected from the gateways in the listen state.
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios/12_2t/12_2t15/feature/guide/ft_glbp.html#wp1043431
A, B and C seems to be correct, so why just GLBP?

questions.question_text: You must configure resiliency for Fibre Channel uplink ports on Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnects. Which feature should you configure?

discussion.content: It should be Increase the VM to host ratio

questions.question_text: Which two business requirements have the most influence on the data center design? (Choose two.)

choices.E: reduce virtual machine to host ratio

questions.question_text: Which two options are reasons to use IP routing to segment a data center instead of Layer 2 routing? (Choose two.)
Which two options are benefits of implementing Cisco FabricPath? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Layer 2 protocols are used for loop avoidance.
choices.A: All links between FabricPath switches are active.
choices.B: The MAC addresses of servers are learned by all FabricPath switches.

comments.content: Apparently conversation based mac learning is a feature of the F series module in the nexus 7k, i dont know if it is the same for the others https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus7000/sw/fabricpath/config/cisco_nexus7000_fabricpath_config_guide_8x/configuring-fabricpath-switching.html#concept_AE6174C6630C4EA0BF87E40EFFB7E9EB
